attributes.comment:
We are in the waiting process for our daughter from China. In the next couple of
weeks, we will begin AGAIN to process our USCIS paperwork. We will need to
get re-fingerprinted and re-apply for I-171H form. We have already spent $685 with
the US government to go through this process once. Now we must go through it
again and spending a total of $1,370. If your fees go up, we will spend $830 on
our SECOND go around. Spending a total of $1,515. International adoption is not
an inexpensive endeavor. It is emotional and monetarily taxing. Your fee
increases are huge (12.5% for fingerprinting and 18.6% for I-600A) Please
reconsider your fee increases. Most families have to go through this process
twice with USCIS now due to the longer waits for most countries to adopt. So you
already are getting a double hit from the vast majority of adopting parents, we find
it unconscionable that you would increase fees on top of that.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Jim and Kim Walden
